posts.body: Inevitably we will be forced to migrate to decentralized platforms that are hard to censor.
Либерахи сосать

>>e5bb7d83-f5cf-41e5-be61-dc5c8a6b679b
If you regularly purge zeronet data you'll have to re-download everything

>>970aea10-19b2-473a-9ed1-da6aea653c7b
Hey mr. Board Owner, how can I contact you? I have previous experience in developing imageboard engine specifically for ZeroNet. In fact, Millchan was based on my original design. Maybe I can help somehow since I think this board won't completely die out even when 8ch.net is restored.

>>89ce5dda-2fa8-46c6-a7b8-6af2f14d3de3
I was on ZeroNet since 2016.

>>f49dacd4-6552-4efa-8272-9ae4af33c737
Good. You retarded boomers have no place on ZeroNet. Please leave.

>>aaba722b-c2ef-4bb8-9254-39347f551f7c
It's not hard to do. Something like 08ch.bit

>>68f052b9-0abe-4f40-bcf9-37cd630283bc
Here's another opinion: write a better engine from scratch and migrate this place to it. And stay here.

>>e1d5663b-9e76-4168-afa5-19a0ebfcfff6
Its approach to user-created boards sucks. You have to opt-out of them instead of opting in (like ZeroMe)

>>e12e14de-789b-4ed6-add3-2d0c9484b734
Actually it's a legitimate concern. Another such concern is the ease of DDoS/spam. I can write a script that will clutter this place to oblivion from however many multiple user certificates (you won't be able to mute one post and disable all of them, will have to mute every post one by one which defeats the purpose of muting). Things like that were the reason for me ceasing development of 0chan back in 2017.

>>4badbe03-e60d-4c27-9dd1-1af29250d770
Doesn't matter, "updated" version of Millchan is still a piece of junk. It needs to be rewritten to use ZeroNet's "Merger Sites" feature. This will allow people to opt-in to boards instead of downloading everything at once and then opting out.

>>d71afc02-eef1-41c6-9267-8ebc5353b25c
P2P connections should be encrypted.

Data folder, however, is not. There really is no good way to protect yourself from a CP bomb. 

In general, there is no good way to store files in ZeroNet right now. Maybe I should look into IPFS and whether it's possible to hook it up to ZeroNet.

Switching between boards is slow purely because of poorly written JS code. My imageboard was working a lot faster. Unfortunately I abandoned it in 2017 and didn't come back to ZeroNet until now. But now I see that it actually has potential, if someone's able to figure out proper secure file storage and also some protection against DDoS/spam.

>>0ec2f2da-481d-4b2c-85ad-a5fccb4f3780
You sound like you don't know what you are talking about. 

> that could be done to any website. 
This is not a "website", it's a collection of json files that are displayed by JS. There is no server to "ban" malicious actors, no possibility to use DDoS protection like Cloudflare/Bitmitigate. No actual working tools to control the content posted here.

> we can prevent that with a simple captcha like on 8chan
There is no server to check if captcha is correct. You really should read up on how ZeroNet works before saying such stupid shit.

>>0c460d86-e205-4598-816a-ab94c5a61be7
Who is retarded enough to think this place was official in the first place? Damn fucking qboomers

>>9f2326a8-562e-4346-9751-a1ea9efc908c
And that would serve what purpose exactly?

>>f52af805-8b8b-4ef4-bf58-db2ec17ace9c
I wouldn't be so optimistic. Once 8ch.net is back and running, this place will lose like 90% of its active posters. Also, the software is not good. I know all of this shit, done that before and abandoned it due to security concerns. Thinking of ways to address those concerns and provide a safe and working p2p platform for messaging.

>>8cae811d-c0dc-49c0-979b-2f47ef97fc6c
Yes, site owner can modify user's file and sign it with his own signature. They can delete and modify whatever. However, you can see in the file which signature was used to sign it, users' or site owners'.

>>1b86b576-9969-4527-bfdc-690e13a8b3c8
>Now explain to me, how does disabling that feature break file upload. You don't need to freedraw anything to upload a file..


Fucking retard. You have to create image thumbnail to upload it. This is why thumbnails are empty on any browser that disables canvas (on Tor browser it's done by default). How about you read source code and stop asking stupid questions?

>>aff355bc-f18a-4b10-9fd7-9a79a732d1ff
Are you actually retarded? There is no blockchain. Read the fucking code. It's simply a collection of JSON files. Authenticity of the file is validated by digital signatures. ZeroNet daemon itself controls the validity of the signatures. User's data can be signed with either user's signature or site owner's.
Allowing tech-illiterate people to use computers was a mistake.

No.

First thing that should be done is to rewrite the engine to use ZeroNet's "Merger Sites" functionality (like ZeroMe does with its "user hubs") so that we wouldn't download and seed all boards by default, but only opt-in to boards that we're interested in.

> using VPN services instead of setting up your own

I want tech illiterate boomers to fuck off

>>a6a58a89-aa72-4bf1-bc70-190a4aef9912
Image thumbnails should be disabled by default. Also, user-created boards should be disabled and opted in instead of enabled by default and opted out of.

>>7dfb1597-f36d-4db5-9ed2-faff06265be2
This would not work. Read the code, faggot.

> uploading files while not having his port open for seeding

fail

>>cc97454e-6770-4b09-b296-3462821f0b37
To each and every one in this thread who doesn't realize the fundamental flaws in Millchan's architecture.

>>ec0c1e0d-0c22-4708-8637-79045e6762fb
DDoS in terms of ZeroNet would be not "ddosing an address" but uploading lots and lots of cluttering user data. Say, thousands of posts every minute which prevent you from accessing the real stuff without interruptions. 

>>e9b5121b-afc3-4e39-94ca-261fae32d8dd
This is just retarded. Guys, please, refrain from commenting if you have no idea how zeronet works. Read the fucking code, for fuck's sake.

>>f1f7df67-503c-4f5f-90b8-91110b44bd4b
I'm not larping. I know exactly how all of this stuff works and what design flaws it has.

>>95a91b91-0847-45e1-a9ff-6435d1ba0787
Lmao there is no backend. You can write a script to replace site's client JS to whatever you want and it will still work with other peers who don't have altered client JS.

>>24d31333-4b4a-4563-95ac-032c76a278bf
The main feature Millchan's engine needs is support for MergerSites to allow an opt-in approach to user-created boards. I'm not sure it can be done in a way that would allow to preserve the posts that already exists and migrate them to MergerSites architecture, need to read up on this.
>>719aee10-2d2d-40c5-8aec-8fb6b28c6177
I'm actually contemplating  just writing my own shit from scratch. By the time I'll have some working version most of current 08chan population will move back to clearnet anyway.

>>1f7ba752-f738-4e6f-877b-b272f3d749e1
1) The client wouldn't even receive data that he doesn't need. Less network overhead, less updates.
2) The board owner would actually be able to moderate the content of his board. Basically, having the same "site owner" privileges as the "site owner" of main site has, but limited to his board (which is in effect a separate ZeroNet site that he has full control over). 

You should look at ZeroMe and its user hubs. This is how it's done.

>>fd914e03-4a94-4f71-92ba-5c2dea098711
>Isn't how that already works (aside from the bug in this version of Millchan)? Are you saying how it currently works is you receive everything and just discard what's muted?

I've just checked how it works on Millchan itself. And yes, "blacklisted" users' data still stays on your hard drive and is being updated. You just don't see it.

>>b53c9d73-72b8-4d35-8c9f-c4cb8b04ea34
This guy is right. I can use whatever version of clientside JS I want. No peer can check if I'm using "the real deal".

>>93dfb6a6-cd85-4263-9201-ac335f76ccdd
> comparing i2p with zeronet

>>47c18cdf-37fc-480b-904c-44bb68dfb65f
Look up IPFS.

>>dd377f66-61ae-4b0b-b072-663408bc8e26
No exit nodes are used. Every peer that has tor enabled just springs up its own hidden service which communicates to other hidden services.

If I understand correctly, currently there is no way to "actually" blacklist users on a multi-user site. ZeroNet doesn't seem to support that. You can either blacklist the whole site or simply ignore user's data on the clientside. But it will still get downloaded and updated. Please correct me if I'm wrong.

>>5fe6b1c6-91dd-4b1b-a483-d0e46f8c4630
When I ran 0chan.bit I used to have a dedicated server set up which was set to "download and distribute all files" so that images would load reliably.

>>97d0e301-d8cc-4717-8ad6-d028ccc1b8be
Silencing is not my concern. I'm concerned that in reality your ZeroNet peer still participates in updating the files of "blacklisted"  users since ZeroNet itself has no user-defined "blacklist" functionality. Backend software does not know that you " blacklisted" someone on some site, it will continue to update their content.json and related files.

>>2ea7ca82-0ac8-4ed9-ac4c-ec220c47bb18
Because in reality there are no numbers, they are recalculated on the fly when you view them. Look at the data files, in reality posts IDs look like "4c4f01a1-451b-49fc-bbc2-0af670ded27c", post links look like that too. It's only when these IDs are displayed in the browser they get re-calculated to imitate integer IDs.

>>6d871018-69ba-4998-963d-a4c6587c979c
The client already knows which post you reply to. Number ids are cosmetical. Although I'm not sure if they work if you simply type the post "number" instead of clicking on the reply button.

>>aa291549-46c7-410c-af97-5eee7a7b0996
Can you give me an example of one such post? I'll check the data.

>>6d1c964b-c840-4b4b-88b1-e6685bd4c18c
Very strange. The data file has "actual" post ID but it's wrong. May be a bug in the software.

posts.subject: Blast from the past
posts.body:
If you're interested in history, here is the first imageboard made on ZeroNet:

http://127.0.0.1:43110/0chan.bit

It even has Millchan developer's thread on it: 
http://127.0.0.1:43110/0chan.bit/?/dev/thread/e3b51befd7e7cc7bf5c4bb79597a221e

This place was abandoned for nearly two years. Now I'm thinking of enhancing it with features that Millchan engine still doesn't have (such as MergerSites boards to allow full "site ownership" and moderation of user-created boards).

>>bec00132-1479-44a6-b8a9-b32bcc74bda5
Look at FAQ, you have to allow Tor Browser to use canvas

> That's fine, this place will populate with actual leftists and mods will get bored.

> being this clueless

First, user who created the board CAN NOT MODERATE IT. It is not possible.

Second, names are not unique. There can be a thousand different boards named /leftypol/.

Fucking retarded tech illiterate boomers, you have no place here.

>>732e3b94-4053-47ee-be70-9f03541cae92
Yeah just saw it.

>>f29981f7-ba92-4d6f-866b-51f18d89464d
Don't mind him, he's tech illiterate.
